fullText: Scott Ellis has directed this beloved Depression-era comedy with a light touch that keeps the sentiment from getting sticky, while still honoring the essential sweetness of the material.

bwwExcerpt: "You Can't Take It With You" declares itself in a stage direction: "This is a house where you do as you like, and no questions asked." That license to live the carefree life of children at play, extended by this 1936 comedy classic by Moss Hart and George S. Kaufman, appealed to a nation sunk in the...
